special functions.title: SetChoice
special functions.explanation: Will set specified choice number to the following string value. Think of them as progress or variable fields you can manually set for an event.

special functions.title: IfChoice
special functions.explanation: Will check for a choice. If it is a match, it then goes to the specified scene. If it is not a match, it will ignore the scene jump and continue the scene.

special functions.title: Menu
special functions.explanation: Gives the player an option menu of choices. Each choice is a scene in the same event file. Make sure the scene names exactly match the choice. Will always end current scene and jump to a new one, thus it is recommended to only have them at the end of a scene.By default, if there are more than 6 choices, page arrows will automatically be added.

special functions.title: HitMonsterWith
special functions.explanation: Hit the monster with a skill. Will not apply stances or status effects from the skill, and does apply recoil damage. It will only damage to the target, and can crit. It will never miss. Uses the player stats. Do not use any skill with a targetType that isn't 'single'.

special functions.title: IfPlayerHasStances
special functions.explanation: Checks the player for every specified stance in the loop. If all stances are true, it jumps to the given scene.

special functions.title: DamagePlayerFromMonster
special functions.explanation: Deal randomized damage to the player via a skill and monster.

special functions.title: GivePerk_spec
special functions.explanation: Gives the player a perk, even if they already have it.

special functions.title: IfHealingSickness
special functions.explanation: Jumps to the given scene if healing sickness is active. Used to actually avoid the refresh scenes for rest points. Only works in events.

events function.title: SkillShoppingMenu
events function.explanation: Opens a skill purchasing menu based on the provided skills, up till 'EndLoop'. Good whitespace formatting is highly recommended for sanity, see how skill shops in the base game are done.

change monster.title: ChangeMonsterLevel
change monster.explanation: Changes the given stat of the focused monster by the given amount. They can take negative values, and it does reset upon leaving the event and/or encounter. These do not produce dialogue.
